page.title: 08THE EXMOUTH LIFEBOAT
page.content: The main problems for lifeboat men nowadays are windsurfers.The lifeboat has on average a call of 1 a week mostly because windsurfers get swept out to sea. People don't realise how quickly they lose strength and they often go out too far or get caught in currents. The service was for shipping but now it is mostly for leisure activities. The Exmouth lifeboat is a 33ft brede which has a top speed of 23knots. It is the fastest in the fleet. The Exmouth lifeboats are powered by two 250 h.p. caterpiller diesels which can operate upside down though not at full speed. On average the institution lifeboats are launched 10 times a day throughout the country. Last year 1307 lives were saved and they were lauched 3536 times for various reasons including practices and demonstrations.
